description: Herpes Simplex Virus is a common viral infection that causes sores on the mouth or genitals. There are two types of herpes simplex virus: HSV-1, which typically causes oral herpes, and HSV-2, which typically causes genital herpes.
possible causes: Direct contact with an infected person's skin or bodily fluids
symptoms: Painful blisters or sores on the affected area
Flu-like symptoms such as fever and body aches
treatments: Antiviral medications to reduce symptoms and prevent outbreaks
Keeping the affected area clean and dry
